description: Atopostipes suicloacalis DSM 15692 is a species of bacteria that was isolated from the swine intestinal tract. It is a Gram-positive, anaerobic, non-spore-forming, and non-motile bacterium. The cells are short rods or coccoid in shape. Atopostipes suicloacalis is a chemoorganotrophic organism, meaning it derives its energy from organic compounds. It is able to ferment a variety of carbohydrates, including glucose, fructose, and lactose, producing acetate, lactate, and hydrogen as the main end products. The optimal growth temperature for this species is around 37Â°C. Atopostipes suicloacalis was first isolated and described in 2005 and is classified within the phylum Firmicutes, class Clostridia, order Clostridiales, and family Lachnospiraceae.
